page.title: 13LATER BALLINDALLOCH HISTORY
page.content: The old turnpike road used to run from Peterfair down towards the church,past Pitchaish House to the ferry crossing the Spey.This ferry was worked at one time by brothers called Black,and from this comes the name Blacksboat by which that place is now known. The inscriptions on the gravestones in the churchyard tell us that many natives of Ballindalloch emigrated in the past to places like America, the West Indies and Australia, to make a living and sometimes even a fortune. On the gravestones are many names of crofts that have now vanished, due to the effects of depopulation and land- amalgamation into larger farm-units. The gravestones show that families used to have far more children, but that many died in infancy,childhood or young adulthood from diseases like diphtheria which are now very rare.
